content.description: Climbs a wide crack with many holds to a balance Crux.  Solid pro.
content.protection: Gear, 1 bolt, anchors shared with Black Froopday.
content.location: Before the hallway on the left.

content.description: A little bit of slab leads to a flake feature before a small ledge.
content.location: Back side of pillar on the right side.

content.description: Great rock, This route only gets 2 stars because of it's inconsistency, otherwise it's great.  Begin on a fantastic basketball sized hueco scoop and move through a really fun but challenging boulder problem until the second bolt.  Significantly easier climbing on beautiful rock leads to the anchors.
content.location: Back side of Froopy Land Pillar, If you look up there is a giant roof, this is the first route climbers right of the roof.  Starts in the cool hueco scoop.

content.description: Pull a hard opening move to gain the crack then your off to the market to get some froops and veggies on this awesome big crack.   Shares anchors with "Fondle My Froopa"
content.protection: Bring a #3 and #4 cam if you've got them.  Otherwise be prepared to search for tiny placements
content.location: Back side of Froopy Land Pillar.  Big obvious crack on the slab face.
Just right of the Froop Doggy Dog arete

content.description: Full of unique and interesting movement, this route climbs around the arete and out the upper face.  This is quality arete climbing with sculpted holds.  Still slightly dirty, watch out for froop doggy dogg's sticky green.
content.location: Arete just outside of froopy tunnel

content.description: Hard crimping off the ground eases up as the climb progresses
content.location: Starts right of the obvious crack seam

content.description: Start the same as Froops and Veggies. Climb the challenging fist to offwidth crack. Can be face climbed with no offwidth moves needed. When you reach the horizontal break, continue straight up for more 5.10 climbing past two more bolts and a set of anchors.
content.location: Middle front of the Froopy Land Pillar.

content.description: Begin on a tricky start move to get your feet up on the face and gain a jug.  Once your feet are up get ready to smear and slimper squeeze your way to the top of this surprisingly fun slab climb.
content.location: On the back side of froopy land pillar, the bolted line climbers right of the crack of "Froops and Veggies"

content.description: Great flakes and bizarre holds down low, solid horizontals up high.
content.location: Before hallway, on left, 10 feet left of obvious crack.  Under cling start.  2 bolts at start, then gear.

content.description: Excellent roped  bouldering.  edges and crimps up a gently overhanging blunt arete.  Beautiful stone and good movement.  This one is short and sweet, but great while it lasts.
content.location: Back Side of Froopy land pillar.  Arete feature

content.description: Large detached pillar leaning against cliff
